snippet: The British parents who took their critically ill child, Ashya, to Spain for treatment without doctors’ consent were released from a prison outside Madrid, their lawyer said.
abstract: Spanish judge orders the release of Brett and Naghemeh King, British parents who took their son Ashya to Spain for treatment without doctors' consent, after getting notification that Britain is no longer seeking their extradition; Ashya, who has severe brain tumor, is hospitalized in Malaga.
lead_paragraph: The British parents who took their critically ill child, Ashya, to Spain for treatment without doctors’ consent were released from a prison outside Madrid, their lawyer said.

headline.main: Charges Dropped Against British Parents of Ill Child
headline.print_headline: Britain: Charges Dropped Against Parents of Ill Child
